description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to establish the multipurpose cadaster in the selected municipalities to a) strengthen tenure security, and b) provide access to cadaster information.

condition.narrative: SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section I. Institutional and Other Arrangements; A. Institutional Arrangements. No later than 90 daysafter the date of this Agreement, the Recipient shall establish and maintain, throughout the implementation of the Project,internal audit arrangements acceptable to the Bank.The first audit report will cover from March 8, 2021 to December 31, 2022; andmust be reported to the Bank no later than April 30, 2023.

SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section I. Institutional and Other Arrangements; A. Institutional Arrangements. The Recipient shallmaintain, throughout the implementation of the Project, a Component Management Unit (CMU) with staffing, resources, and functionsas outlined in the Operational Manual.In July 2021, Fondo Acción completed the establishment of the Implementing Management Unit,with 19 professionals in charge of developing administrative, contractual, financial, and monitoring activities for the AF. Thisteam also supports the entire technical, administrative and legal structure of the implementing agency (FA).

SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section I. Institutional and Other Arrangements; A. Institutional Arrangements. The Recipient shallparticipate throughout the implementation of the Project in the Project Steering Committee.Operational Committees are heldmonthly between GoC, WB, Donor, the United Kingdom Embassy in Colombia, and Implementing Partners.

SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section I. Institutional and Other Arrangements; A. Institutional Arrangements. The Recipient shallparticipate throughout the implementation of the Project in the Project Technical Committee.The Grant Agreement was declaredeffective on March 8, 2021. Activities are being achieved as planned (shown in the Results Framework). Technical Committee'ssessions are held monthly.

SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section I. Institutional and Other Arrangements; B Interinstitutional Agreement and ImplementingPartner Agreements. No later than four (4) months after the Signature Date, the Recipient shall enter into an agreement (theInterinstitutional Agreement) with the Implementing Partners under terms and conditions acceptable to the Bank, including thecoordination arrangements between the Recipient and the Implementing Partners.On July 7, 2021, the implementing partners signedan Inter-institutional Agreement (DNP-768, PNN-001, SNR-5318, IGAC-124, FA-124), which establishes the general conditions ofoperation and commitments for each of the implementing partners regarding the implementation of Component 5.

SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section I. Institutional and Other Arrangements; C. Operational Manual. The Recipient, shall no laterthan 90 days after the date of this Agreement, prepare, adopt and, carry out Part 5 of the Project according to the provisions of amanual (the Operational Manual) satisfactory to the Bank, containing, inter alia: (a) the activities and timetable of actions to becarried out under the Project; (b) the respective roles, responsibilities, and coordination mechanisms of the ImplementingEntities; (c) the composition and responsibilities of the CMU; (d) the fiduciary, technical and operational aspects and proceduresfor implementation of the Project, including the financial management procedures (budgeting, accounting, and internal control,disbursement and flow of funds, financial reporting, annual reports, internal and external audit arrangements procedures); (e) theperformance indicators for the Project; and (f) the ESMF, IPP, RPF and the Anti-Corruption Guidelines.On March 16, 2021, theSteering Committee of the AF approved the Operations Manual, containing guidelines for the management and operation of the AF. TheWB approved it on April 29, 2021.

SCHEDULE 2 Project Execution; Section II. Project Monitoring, Reporting, and Evaluation; A. Project Reports. The Recipient shallensure that each Project Report for Part 5 of the Project is furnished to the Bank not later than forty-five days after the end ofeach calendar semester, covering the calendar semester.Reports comprising Component 5 are being incorporated into the semiannualreports from the parent project and reviewed by the Bank accordingly.

Schedule 2, Section I. A. 1 (a) Up to ninety (90) days after Effective Date, create and maintain, throughout Projectimplementation, a Project Director and Project Coordination Unit (PCU) with staffing and functions outlined in the OperationalManual.The Government of Colombia has fully set up the Coordination Unit within the National Planning Department (DNP).

Schedule 2, Section I. A. 1 (b) Create and maintain, throughout Project implementation: (i) Management Units (MU) within IGAC, ANT,and SNR, with staffing and functions outlined in the Operational Manual.The Management Units at the Geographic Institute AgustínCodazzi (IGAC), National Land Agency (ANT), Superintendence of Notaries and Registry (SNR) were created and are currently fullyfunctional.

Schedule 2, Section I. A. 1 (c) Create and maintain, throughout Project implementation, the Project Steering Committee, withcomposition and functions set forth in the Operational Manual.The Steering Committee was created and is operational. Sessions areheld monthly.

Schedule 2, Section I. A. 1 (d) Create and maintain, throughout Project implementation, the Project Technical Committee, withcomposition and functions outlined in the Operational Manual.Technical Committee was created and is operational. Sessions areheld monthly.

Schedule 2, Section I. D. 3. Not later than thirty (30) days after Effective Date, the Borrower shall adopt the OperationalManual in a manner and with contents acceptable to the Bank.The Operations Manual was updated and approved by the Project'sSteering Committee and Technical Committee. The Bank approved it on August 18, 2021.

Schedule 2, Section IV. A. The Borrower, through IGAC, shall, no later than six (6) months from the Signing Date, approvesimplified regulations for cadastral surveying, satisfactory to the Bank.IGAC approved the simplified regulations and technicalrequirements for systematic cadastral surveying (Resolution 388, 04/13/2020). The regulations are technically satisfactory to theBank.

Schedule 2, Section IV. B. The Borrower, through ANT, shall, no later than six (6) months from the Signing Date, approve, withinits institutional competence, simplified regulations or procedures for land tenure formalization, satisfactory to the Bank.Theprocesses for formulating the Rural Land Tenure Formalization Plans were simplified (Resolution 12096/2019). Nonetheless, ANT isstill technically reviewing the processes and procedures for implementing these plans, particularly regarding the fieldworkactivities with IGAC.The methodology to calculate Family Agricultural Units (Unidades Agrícolas Familiares UAF) and HomogeneousPhysical Units at the Submunicipal scale was approved in session No. 54 of 4/28/2021 at the ANT Board of Directors for itsimplementation in the selected municipalities.

title.narrative: Number of municipalities with access to, and capacity to use, the cadaster data for planning and other purposes
National Cadaster System (Sistema Nacional Catastral) redesigned and in operation
Number of new web services available under NSDI
Percentage of grievances/complaints resolved in 10 working days
Number of methodological guidelines designed for ethnic territories
Processes and operations supported by the Cadaster-Registry Master Data Repository
Number of parcels titled and registered
Number of parcels with updated data in the National Cadaster System (Sistema Nacional Catastral)
Number of streamlined processes in operation
Number of persons with titles issued (individual or collective)
Number of registry offices with information in digital format
Area within project municipalities with cadastral and property information updated
Number of women with titles issued (individual or joint property titles)
Satisfaction of beneficiaries with the cadaster process
People with increased knowledge through communication strategies
Conservation agreements with vulnerable families located in strategic environmental zones and deforested areas
Number of environmental and local entities, conducting analysis of environmental and cadastral information provided by SIAC.
Number of Land use rights signed by beneficiaries located in forest reserves
People successfully trained on cadastral systems on e.g. tenure rights, land tenure restrictions and responsibilities
New tools and studies leading to improved cadastral system management
